page.title: 13RELIGION, RUGELEY & COLTON
page.content: The one church in Colton is St. Mary's and is Anglican. At present there is no resident vicar for this small village parish. The Sunday services are Communion, Family Service and Evensong. About 30 children attend Sunday School. There is a women's meeting mid-week and a Mother's Union. The church in the northern part of Rugeley is St. Augustines and is Anglican. The vicar is the Rev. John Easton. About 110 people attend Sunday services of Communion, Family Service and Evensong. Children from the age of 3 attend Sunday School. The teenagers youth group is called SAGE and meets weekly. There are men's and women's groups which meet throughout the week. Elsewhere in Rugeley there is a Roman Catholic Church and Non-Conformist Churches. The population of Rugeley is about 30,000.
